H0.text: Grains of sand are the component in soils that are rich in them, providing the conditions in which plants grow best.

H1.text: Lumps of clay are the component of soils in which plants grow best.

H2.text: Layers of gravel are the component that makes soils rich for plants to grow best.

H3.text: Decaying plants and animals are what soils that are rich in for plants that grow best.

A4.text: The organic matter in soil derives from plants, animals and microorganisms.

A5.text: An important property of soil organic matter is that it improves the capacity of a soil to hold water and nutrients, and allows their slow release, thereby improving the conditions for plant growth.
